user.speaker: user
user.text: how can I estimate my costs?

agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: To estimate your costs, you can use the IBM Cloud cost estimator tool. Here are the steps to follow: 1. Go to the IBM Cloud console and click on the Cost estimator icon. 2. Click on 'Create new estimate' and enter a name and description for the estimate. 3. Click on 'Create' and you will be directed to the estimate details page. 4. Click on 'Go to catalog' to add products to the estimate. 5. Select the product you are interested in and choose your pricing plan and enter any necessary configuration details. 6. Click on 'Add to estimate'. 7. Enter your estimated usage and click on 'Calculate Cost'. You can adjust the estimated usage and recalculate the cost to see how different usage levels affect the overall cost. By default, the estimator shows the pricing and billing currency set for your account. If you're estimating costs for a different location or currency, you might have to select the appropriate currency on the order summary page for the product or change the currency on your account. Once you have added all the products to your estimate, review the product details and click on 'View estimate' to see the total estimated cost.

contexts.text:
Estimating your costs 

You can use the cost estimator to estimate the cost of IBM CloudÂ® products by customizing plans that fit your business needs. Your account type doesn't affect your estimates. Explore the catalog to find available products to add to an estimate.

Estimates can now be saved to an account. Make sure you're in the account that you want to save the estimate to. If you have existing estimates, they must be converted to a saved estimate that is attached to an account.



 Creating a new estimate 



1. In the IBM Cloud console, go to Cost estimator icon![Cost estimator icon](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs-content/v1/content/9713d864488177dc6b273b53b7f2383a81f10bc1/icons/calculator.svg). From here, you are directed to Estimating your costs page.
2. Click Create new estimate.
3. Enter a name and description for the estimate.
4. Click Create
5. From here, you are directed to the estimate details page. Click Go to catalog to add products to the estimate.
6. Select the product that you are interested in.

Depending on the product, an interim informational page might be displayed. For example, if you select Bare Metal Servers, an informational page that describes various features is displayed. Click Continue.
7. Select your pricing plan and enter other configuration details if needed. Then, click Add to estimate.

Some products might require that you log in to add them to an estimate.
8. Enter your estimated usage, and click Calculate Cost. You can adjust the estimated usage and recalculate the cost to see how different usage levels affect the overall cost.



By default, the estimator shows the pricing and billing currency set for your account. Pricing can vary by region. If you're estimating costs for a different location or currency, you might have to select the appropriate currency on the order summary page for the product or change the currency on your account.

contexts.text:
Enter your estimated usage, and click Calculate Cost. You can adjust the estimated usage and recalculate the cost to see how different usage levels affect the overall cost.



By default, the estimator shows the pricing and billing currency set for your account. Pricing can vary by region. If you're estimating costs for a different location or currency, you might have to select the appropriate currency on the order summary page for the product or change the currency on your account.



1. Click Save and select the estimate that you'd like to add the product to, and then add the calculated cost to your estimate by clicking Save.
2. When you're done adding products to your estimate, review the product details, and click View estimate.







 Updating an existing estimate 

You can always update the name and description of an estimate as your needs change. To edit an estimate, complete the following steps:



1. From the View Estimate page, identify the estimate that you want to edit.
2. Click the Actions icon ![Actions icon](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs-content/v1/content/9713d864488177dc6b273b53b7f2383a81f10bc1/icons/action-menu-icon.svg) > Edit.
3. Enter the updated name and description.
4. Click Save







 Saving and sharing your estimate 

When you create an estimate, you can save each estimate's unique link to share or revisit directly through your browser. To share an estimate, complete the following steps:



1. From the View Estimate page, identify the estimate that you want to share.
2. Click the Actions icon ![Actions icon](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs-content/v1/content/9713d864488177dc6b273b53b7f2383a81f10bc1/icons/action-menu-icon.svg) > Share.
3. Click Copy link and share the link with users in your account.







 Creating quotes for classic infrastructure services

ml.tokens.model_text: You can use the cost estimator to estimate the cost

agent.original_text:
To estimate your costs, you can use the IBM Cloud cost estimator tool. Here are the steps to follow:
1. Go to the IBM Cloud console and click on the Cost estimator icon.
2. Click on 'Create new estimate' and enter a name and description for the estimate.
3. Click on 'Create' and you will be directed to the estimate details page.
4. Click on 'Go to catalog' to add products to the estimate.
5. Select the product you are interested in and choose your pricing plan and enter any necessary configuration details.
6. Click on 'Add to estimate'.
7. Enter your estimated usage and click on 'Calculate Cost'. You can adjust the estimated usage and recalculate the cost to see how different usage levels affect the overall cost.
By default, the estimator shows the pricing and billing currency set for your account. However, if you're estimating costs for a different location or currency, you might have to select the appropriate currency on the order summary page for the product or change the currency on your account.
Once you have added all the products to your estimate, review the product details and click on 'View estimate' to see the total estimated cost.
